TaxonIdentification.species_name: 南川薹草 nan chuan tai cao

treatment.description: Rhizome obliquely ascending, thick, woody, rigid. Culms lateral, 20–35 cm tall, compressed trigonous, smooth, clothed at base with dark brown sheaths disintegrating into fibers. Leaves surpassing culm, blades green, linear, 1.2–1.8 mm wide, flat, upper margins scabrous. Involucral bracts shortly bladed, scabrous on margins, long sheathing. Spikes 4 or 5; terminal spike male, clavate-cylindric, 2.2–3 cm; lateral spikes 3 or 4, female, occasionally with few male flowers at apex, cylindric, 4–5.5 × ca. 1.5 cm, densely flowered; peduncles erect. Female glumes lanceolate, dark green 3-veined costa excurrent into a mucro. Utricles yellow-green, slightly longer than glume, obliquely patent, subglobose (excluding beak), 6–7 mm (including beak), membranous, sparsely pubescent, with very prominent veins, base shortly stipitate, apex abruptly contracted into a cylindric long beak, orifice 2-toothed. Nutlets dark purple-black, tightly enveloped, subglobose, ca. 2 mm, trigonous with angles constricted at middle, faces concave at base, apex with a very short beak; style base thickened; stigmas 3. Fl. Jun.
